revised_title: Experimental Evidence of Mercury Molecule Formation
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the formation of mercury molecules in the vapor state. They used an ionization chamber and a magnetic analyzer to analyze the ions and found evidence of diatomic mercury molecular ions (Hg2+) being formed by the attachment of excited atoms to normal atoms. This discovery reconciles the chemical evidence of mercury vapor being monatomic with the band spectra evidence of its presence.
